topics.body:
So a bit of new news on genetic engineering. . . . I swear to god if this becomes a GMO vs natural debate I'm going to shove their wallet so far up their ass they're going to have to open their mouth to show people their driver's license. . . but anyways on genetic engineering. . . don't tempt me. . it's now genetic engineering to genetically altered endangered species and plants to reverse extinction when the cause of the loss of population is known.  What I mean by this is a type of tree the last couple of decades has been massively dying due to a certain type of fungal infection is now being looked at to insert a gene that grants it immunity to reverse the loss of population.

Basically what I mean by this is genetic engineering is now being seriously looked at to reverse extinction when the cause of the loss of population is something preventable.  So like lets say a species of frog or such is dying out due to fungal infection; if you give it a immunity to that it'll bounce back.

Basically genetically vaccinating species.

Yes.



But in all seriousness this doesn't have anything to do whatsoever with producing crops before that inevitable shit storm happens; so anyone that jumps the shark here and says that it's for crops is a idiot cause I don't think anyone here would eat tree bark or poisonous frogs.  It's simply vaccinating endangered species.

topics.body:
Also in science news:
Apparently video games actually reduce violence.  It's theoretical at this point, but apparently the theory behind it is that the high from video games can actually reduce violence in that you're getting a high enough to counter act the negative chemicals associated with causing violence.  To put it bluntly enjoying things makes you less likely to shoot someone.
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a9fa1b6368721924b30200#post_53a9fa1b6368721924b30200
I didn't say it was perfect; I just said it would help with biological reasons for loss of population.
